POINTS POSITIFS :
- Super concept
- Jeu Disponible sur PS4, XBOX et PC. Bientôt sur Switch
- De nouveaux DLC sortent tous les 3 - 5 mois 
- Système de progression Sympa
POINTS NEGATIFS 
- La communauté est vraiment horrible, les survivants toxics (t-bag, bodyblock) et les campeurs et ceux qui focus, cela rend le jeu chiant
- Beaucoup trop de bugs
- Jeu vraiment répétitif 
- Le jeu crash beaucoup trop 
- Les DLC sous licence sont payants 
BREF, ce jeu a beaucoup de potentiel mais bon, le jeu est de pire en pire, je conseil plus Friday the 13 qui est un excellent jeu mais il n'est plus en développement (allez voir sur google), BISOUS <3

This game is simply amazing. Being able to choose between the killer or the survivor, i feel like it was the ultimate horror game. I will say I'm more of a killer than the survivor but bot are fun. 

Pros:

-The killers all have different ways to kill you, so the matches are always different in terms of what to expect.
- Playing as a team when being the survivors really makes the game worthwhile, while also saying screw a team mate and running for the exit def gives you multiple options on how a match turns out.
- It is more than just fixing generators, really push the killer to the limit and boost your score.

Cons:

- Killers camp a lot in this game, so it takes away from the match.
- It has been out for a few, so new players, dont get discouraged when the "experts" run a match like you weren't even there, it happens. Just keep playing and you will get it.
- The lag can ruin a game.

I give this game a 9/10. It really has been awesome.

lo devolvi por estar asquerosamente mal optimizado

Actualización 26-12-2019

Tras un buen par de updates puedo decir que el juego esta aceptable.

Um das gleich schon mal vorweg zu nehmen: Ich beziehe mich in dieser Review hauptsächlich auf das Gameplay als Killer, da ich diesen einfach intensiver gespielt habe als die Überlebenden und bin deshalb wahrscheinlich etwas voreingenommen.

Empfehle ich dieses Spiel?
Klare Antwort: Ja.

Ich habe letztes Jahr Ende August angefangen dieses Spiel zu spielen, da es mir von mehreren Freunden nahegelegt wurde. Bis heute habe ich keine Sekunde bereut, die ich mit diesem außergewöhnlichen Spiel verbracht habe. 
Vom ersten Moment an, wenn man das Spiel öffnet und einem die gruselige aber auch Hoffnung spendende Musik entgegen dröhnt bis hin zu dem Moment, in dem man seinen Lieblingscharakter auf Prestige 3 bringt ist Dead By Daylight einfach super! 

Worum geht es?

Wie ihr vielleicht schon gelesen habt, ist DbD ein asymetrisches Horrorspiel, bei dem 4 Überlebende gegen einen Killer antreten. Den Killern steht dabei ein breites Arsenal an Waffen und übernatürlichen Kräften zu Verfügung, die benutzt werden können um die Überlebenden an der Flucht zu hindern. Diese müssen, um dies zu erreichen, 5 Generatoren reparieren, um die Ausgangstore mit Strom zu versorgen.

Was macht den Reiz aus?

Für mich war es am Anfang ganz klar das Konzept des "allmächtigen" Killers, der die Überlebenden das Fürchten lehrt. Nach nun knapp 700 Stunden muss ich sagen, das diese Fantasie leider nur Fantasie bleibt. 
Um die Spieler in Fähigkeitsklassen einzuteilen gibt es in diesem Spiel Ränge. Von 20-1. Hierbei ist zu beachten, dass ein "schlechter" Killer immer besser ist als 4 "schlechte" Überlebende. Wenn man jedoch die Rangleiter erklimmt, tritt das genaue Gegenteil ein. Die Überlebenden sind nur noch extrem schwer fassbar und egal wie viel Erfahrung oder Können man mitbringt, es ist kaum noch Möglich mit einigen Killer alle 4 Überlebenden in einer Runde zu erwischen. 
Den Überlebenden helfen Perks (freischaltbare Fähigkeiten) wie "Selbstheilung", "Sprintboost", oder "Geliehene Zeit" die nur sehr schwer zu Kontern sind.
Als Killer ist man auf Charaktere wie die Krankenschwester angewiesen, die verschiedene Mechaniken wie "Palletlooping" aushebeln kann.
Trotzdem ist es sehr zufriedenstellend, wenn man es dennoch schafft, siegreich hervor zu gehen.

Fazit: 
Dead By Daylight ist seine 19,99 allemal wert. Es ist das zweitmeist (nach Skyrim) gespielte Spiel in meiner Bibliothek, und das will bei fast 150 Games schon was heißen.
Es braucht noch eine Bugfixes und Balance-Patches aber das Spiel ist auf einem guten Weg!

This game has its outstanding features and annoying flaws. One is likely to play this game for hundreds, if not for thousands, of hours. Please take into consideration that the dev team has proven to be very incompetent a large majority of the time, proven so by them making a series of horrible decisions for the game's health and future. Every terrible decision that's been made has ruined this game more than I can even put into words or fit into this review. It's absolutely pathetic how this game went from being super enjoyable in 2016/17, to present day, where it is a shadow of its former self. It's incredibly sad as I have so many fond memories and good times with this game. Ultimately though, I still find enough enjoyment in this game to recommend it to a certain extent.

This is the first time I have ever re written a review, I mark it as Don't Recommend for a few reasons, a few BIG reasons. So here we go. And let me preface this by saying, I am a Red Rank Killer, Green Rank Survivor playing since around the release of Huntress. I may not be the most qualified but I have experienced A LOT of the bull shit in this game.

Reason number 1: The dev team do not understand their own community. Every single update and change has been favored to low ranking players, and people who cannot compete at higher ranks. However, once you reach those high levels, the balance is thrown so far out of proportion and there is nothing as a killer that you can do about it. And now with the nerfs to the only viable killer at red ranks, the game is becoming unplayable once more, falling back into the dark times. 

Reason number 2: Those oh so grand micro transactions and the new "Rift Pass" aka Battle Pass knock offs from every other MOBA and Battle Royale title out there. You can say all you want that the unlockables are only cosmetic and have nothing to do with overall ability to play well. However this is just not true. In order to get the top tier perks for both Killer and Survivor sides, they are locked behind paid DLC. You can unlock these through the in game currency, if you have a few hundred hours to spare grinding away. The entire system is backwards and goes against your customer base, telling them to pay up, or get grindin.

Reason 3: And one of the biggest downfalls of this game; If you are a competitive player, and desire to get the high rank game play and end game rewards, there is nothing here for you. The only things you get as you progress higher in rank are; 20 minute queue times, sweaty and toxic matches, some toxic comments on your profile, and overall BM from both sides. The community has taken what is essentially a casual coop horror game and turned it into this huge pot of different styles, interactions, and an overall identity crisis.

Reason 4: There is zero separation between players who wish to play competitively and those who want a more casual experience, sort of tying into reason 3 but whatever. If there was any game that would benefit from a ranked mode, it is this game. Separate the matching into Casual and Ranked play, where the Ranked side has an option to ban certain killers, perks, items and power addons, and maps. Give the competitive player base something to strive towards and allow them an avenue to express themselves in that environment and let the more casual audience inhabit their's.

Reason 5: Hit boxes are STILL broken. Don't even have to say anything just hop in and see for yourself.


Reason 6: SWF breaks this game, and there are plenty of big names in the community and plenty of streams and videos out there to support this. It's just plain and simple and if you deny it, you are just as bad for this game as Decisive Strike, and Hex: NOED.


The game in its current state should not be taken seriously, that is obviously the message the developers keep pushing. It's only a matter of time before the big content creators stop supporting it, and move on, which has already begun. If something doesn't change soon, the game is gonna die. And I truly love this game, I love everything about it. And it really is a shame to see it going down an even more toxic road. 

Overall final comments about the game. If you are someone looking for a fun game to play with maybe some buddies, or something to challenge yourself, "...why not go try Civilization?" - Mathieu Ceto, Developer of this game, 2018

Симулятор выхода из багов и ора дцп.
Как бы ты не пытался подняться сейчас с рангами, какие бы у тебя не были руки до 13 ранга, ты обязательно наткнешься на какую-то хуйню, которая испортит тебе всю игру, будь то поросятки, которые ничего не делают или же маньяки, которые кроме кемперства ничерта не умеют. Но поднявшись выше, у тебя начнется пригорание твоей дырки из-за долгого подбора катки, а уж совместно с друзьями ты вообще взлетишь до небес с этим ожиданием. А если и залетишь, то обязательно левые свинки будут до 80 часов, которые даже не понимают что можно делать что-то еще помимо геников или ора что все так быстро сливаются, а он такой классненький продержался дольше всех, пушто просидел всю игру в шкафце.
А про баги, где реально застопить любого маньяка на всю игру, и сурв застрявший у дерева, в крюке или еще в какой-то текстуре это отдельная тема.
Хотя, если ты полностью отбитый и уже готов подставлять всех, ента игруля для тебя, мой друг.

Пару слов в защиту кемперов. С таким матчмейкингом не маньяк урод ,ибо он не виноват ,что в матч он зашел с голой жопой первого уровня без перков. Попав на "заряженных" выживших кемперить единственный шанс хоть чутка поднять. Такие дела. Конечно это работает и в обратную сторону скажете вы тип мол : заряженный маньяк на нубов ,но опять же тут виноват не человек ,а балансировщик.

Broken legacy code that will never be fixed (there will be no profit in it)

NFT's

SBMM in a casual pvp game (despite the Devs themselves saying an SBMM won't work for DBD)

Constantly removing gameplay mechanics and changing killers who the community universally agreed didn't need changing (Billy & Nurse).

Maps with massive dead zones so devoid of options, that if a survivor is caught in one, they are going to get downed. No exceptions.

Camping and tunneling is at an all time high (since SBMM just rewards the killers for kills only).

Brain dead survivors clueless about basic mechanics, and are useless to the team. Playing survivor often feels like a 1vs4 and you are the 1.

A ranking system that tells bad players that they are actually good. When most of the actual good players have stopped playing because the game is either too easy (as killer) or too boring (as survivor)

All in all its no longer fun. People who want to have fun are outnumbered by the people who think this is some kind of Esports PVP game. If DBD hadn't gotten all those licensed characters, this game would have died years ago.
